item.title: Congratulating the University of Arizona Wildcats for winning the 2007 National Collegiate Athletic Association Division I Softball Championship.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Higher Education, Lifelong Learning, and Competitiveness.

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S8154-8155; text as passed Senate: CR S8155; text of measure as introduced: CR S8090)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S8154-8155; text as passed Senate: CR S8155; text of measure as introduced: CR S8090)

summary.text: Congratulates the University of Arizona Wildcats for winning the 2007 National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) Division I Women's Softball Championship.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Congratulates the University of Arizona Wildcats for winning the 2007 National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) Division I Women's Softball Championship.

bill.title: A resolution congratulating the University of Arizona Wildcats for winning the 2007 NCAA Division I Softball Championship.

item.title: A resolution congratulating the University of Arizona Wildcats for winning the 2007 NCAA Division I Softball Championship.
A resolution congratulating the University of Arizona Wildcats for winning the 2007 NCAA Division I Softball Championship.

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S8154-8155; text as passed Senate: CR S8155; text of measure as introduced: CR S8090)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
